content.label: Would love to see an expansion pack though. More customizations with regards to items would be nice.

Don’t let the 2-D scrolling platform dissuade you: This is a rich and fun turn-based romp thru a robot-space-pirate-steam-punk world with an awesome soundtrack (available on Apple Music: Yay!).  Procedurally generated levels, reactive enemy AI, and a seemingly endless loot table of “rare” weapons and gear make it infinitely replayable.  And then there’s the hats.  When a rare, as yet uncollected hat adorns the head of an enemy, you will risk everything to spend a turn shooting it off rather than deliver max damage.  I’ve played thru on “experienced” “veteran” and “elite” difficulties, and still want more.  Elite is ruthless.  But in a good way.

There are just enough RPG elements to let you invest your imagination without option paralysis.  The shared inventory size doesn’t allow for nostalgia over your early gear.  While loading-out for a mission, each crew member gets to equip only 4 things. Each has their own ability progression, but no choices to leave you pondering options. The variety comes from which members you develop by taking them on missions.

The only technical glitch I’ve encountered is that sometimes after playing a good while (an hour or 3), the sound effects track goes silent.  Restarting the app restores it.  Otherwise rock-solid.

Can’t wait for the sequel!

[Devs:  Please please PLEASE port the “Outsider” DLC to iOS!]

It is a very good game, but short. I was kind of shocked when I finished it, because I assumed there was a lot more gameplay left. I enjoyed the time I spent playing it, but my budget is tight and I rarely splurge on games. I really wish I would have bought something I could get more hours out of. 

My other criticism is the conversations between the crew. They are really unnecessary and it’s cumbersome to click all over the ship to talk to the other characters for no reason. I guess it’s supposed to be cute or funny? It’s more annoying than anything.

I know there have to be people like me, who find 99% of mobile games (even some very popular ones) woefully shallow, basic, boring, and generally aimed at kids. At least half of them are just a veneer for micro-transactions, many are ports of games that are much better experienced the way they were intended, and the ones that you can tell are from original creative developers that LOOK SO GOOD in the trailers often just feel incomplete and underwhelming after about an hour. If you love mobile games, that’s great, I’m glad for you.

My entire point is that if you are like me and you keep finding disappointment in this medium, this is one of those 7 or 8 diamonds in the rough games on iOS. It’s fun for a mobile game, it’s fun for a game just in general—the game is just a lot of fun. Play it on veteran difficulty, get a scoped pistol as soon as possible, and have a blast ricocheting bullets into robot skulls, with light but well done RPG mechanics. Worth 5 bucks.

PS If you do happen to read this, happen to feel similar to me, and buy the game and happen to enjoy it, go buy the Banner Saga trilogy too.

Thanks

This game has brought so much joy to me just because of the pure creativity in it. All the weapons and options you have are great and the story itself if so fun! Fight back evil and keep on finding more and more bigger, badder enemies ahead. Highly would recommend to anyone who enjoys good old pirate steam punk themed action! Only request I have is to have the DLC available on iOS. To have that added will give the game even more replay value and the extra weapons and items would be a welcomed addition to anyone’s game. Thank you Devs for such a wonderful game I hope to see more of this fine work in the future!

Got over 50 hours into this game. Love that I can play in small chunks of time. Great looking and well balanced gameplay. Pay once and you’re done! Completely offline so you can play anywhere without worrying about data or WiFi connectivity. Mobile gaming done right; flawless execution!

title.label: Worth the money.  A quality game

content.label:
The game is fun.  Stage 1 is fun because you have to learn the mechanics of trick shots.  Stage 2 is tough because the enemies are far tougher.  After that is gets very easy because the characters you play with are fully buffed with abilities.  But the enemies are more varied and you find more crew.
I also like that at any level you can change the games difficulty level.  How nice is that!

Cons are the replay value is “why bother?”.  You do not get any areas new to explore or new abilities / stages to unlock after winning the game.  

There are 5 difficulty levels as I mentioned, so a bit more on that now... 
The “experienced” is the standard medium.  Anything less challenging and the game is too easy and goes too quick.  “Veteran” is like a hard mode.  “Elite” is a I am a glutton for punishment and abuse mode, especially in the beginning of the game.  But as stated, the replay factor is not there so after the first run through you likely will not want to invest the hours to play again so my suggestion is try the hardest level first and scale back if it’s too difficult.  You lose nothing this way during first play through.

To people thinking that this game is about a proper cowboy action game, well, they probably don’t look to Apple mobile store anyway. This is actually a perfect example of how the marketplace (not just apple store) is littered with literally 100% “you can’t use this weapon because you are playing this X class” games, and the ones that allow it are all PvP games only. Real cowboys just do whatever they want, so the nerd hypocrisy and worship as a cult religion is written all over the place, while being triggered when asking for more of a moderate balance (which is why it is a bad thing, not a good thing). That’s why this game only gets a three, but most people won’t know this! because yes it’s very well done for yet another dungeons and dragons strategy rpg (when has that not yet been done before?). Will continue to rate low and people should do so until the market for all games reaches more of a fifty fifty balance so that everyone can be happy. Can’t please everyone with just DND. With that said, this game manages to have a nice balance of action, after the fact that players will be faced with mostly female robot characters crafted by mostly developers with foreign European names. It’s bizarre to say the least, but at least aiming guns is sort of intuitive, until characters shake their hands (even being robots) which will throw off some players’ aim that are seeking weapons without laser sights and the four slot inventory also has some weird failings like not being able to equip armor if people want grenades and a medpak. However the gunshots, explosions, robotic parts gibs (hats and all), remains to be satisfying, and the cowboy theme with steam and water actually picks the game off the otherwise incredibly massive list of problems with the game weighing it down to the floor. With the world so flocking to DND, can see why this game gets a five or four, but not from the rest of us. 🤠
The game is great, but the screen usage on the iPhone X is terrible with black bars taking up about a third of the display.
Please add in fullscreen for the 12.9”. HDR and 120hz too. Thanks. And why not have iCloud support as well.

Anyways, aside from this annoying gripe of mine, the game is easily one of the best on iOS.

“There’s no way this game deserves all this hype..it looks awesome but boring as hell”

“The camera is too close and probably makes the game feel claustrophobic”

That’s two examples of the negative assumptions I made before buying this game but there was also a strange feeling that I should still give it a try..and I’m so glad I did. Also, I think I’ve only ever left like one or two reviews in the years I’ve had my iPhone because most games are decent and there are plenty of awesome classic RPGs, newer Indy games, etc. but I almost never feel like it’s awesome enough for me to write a review. That’s not the case for this gem.

They integrated a strategy into a 2D world perfectly, the dialogue/characters are awesome and surprisingly developed with their own personalities, the game play is fluid and super satisfying..I could go on but instead I’m just gonna tell you to stop reading these reviews and get it. It’s seriously 5 dollars. I wouldn’t have felt ripped off even if it had cost me $20..but the awesome devs made it cheap enough for almost anyone to get. So make sure you’re near a charger because you’re about to drain the hell out of your battery from not being able to put it down!

And on the super small off chance that the dev(s) see this, please keep making games. I absolutely love how you spend money to buy the game and get the actual game without being bombarded with ads and pop ups begging you to give them money for their “premium” currency. Nope, you spend 5 bucks and the game is 100% yours. The designs/art is phenomenal and the bright color palette is so pleasing to the eyes..so I really hope you all have something in the works after seeing that almost 100% of the reviews are 5 stars and that the very few negative ones are almost all due to something other than the game itself. So again, thank you so much for this awesome and cheap game!

title.label: Great game but add content plz

content.label: I haven’t played since I beat the last update. Please add more content and I would love to play and beat the game again. Thanks

I saw this game a while back, but only just now decided to buy it, a couple months ago. From the minute I opened it up, I could see the talent that went into the artwork of this game. I love the style in which the characters are created, and I love how each one is so individual. I can definitely tell a lot of hard work was put into developing this game, and it does not disappoint.
